requirements.summary: Build core storefront pages and cart/checkout UX (Home, Shop, category filtering, Product Detail, Cart, Checkout, and order confirmation).
acceptanceCriteria: Navigation exists for Home, Shop, Cart, and Checkout.
Users can browse products on a listing page and open a product detail page.
Users can add/remove items and change quantities in the cart.
Checkout form validates required fields (name, email, address) before allowing order placement.
After placing an order, the UI shows an order confirmation state with an order ID.

file_operations.description: Create the app shell (header + footer) and wire all required routes and navigation (Home, Shop, Product Detail, Cart, Checkout, and Order Confirmation) ensuring no pages are orphaned.
Implement Home page with hero section, featured products section (derived from product list), and clear navigation CTAs to Shop and Cart.
Implement Product Listing page with category filtering UI and product grid; ensure product cards navigate to Product Detail.
Implement Product Detail page with product gallery/primary image, price, description, and selectable size/color controls when available; include Add to Cart behavior.
Implement Cart page with line items, quantity controls, remove actions, subtotal/total summary, and CTA to Checkout.
Implement Checkout page with shipping form (name/email/address required) and Place Order action; block submission until validation passes; show progress/disabled states while submitting.
Implement confirmation state after successful order placement and display the returned order ID; provide a route target for redirect after checkout.
Add cart state management (context or lightweight store) with add/remove/update quantity, persisted to localStorage for MVP continuity.

Create a reusable ProductCard component for listing/featured sections; compose (do not modify) existing shadcn-ui components where appropriate. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a reusable quantity stepper control used by Cart line items; compose (do not modify) existing shadcn-ui components where appropriate. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a consistent header with VUURIX brand, primary navigation links (Home/Shop/Cart/Checkout), and cart item count indicator.
Create a minimal footer consistent with the fashion-forward theme and English UI text.

requirements.summary: Use React Query to load products/product details and to create orders via the backend canister, with visible loading and error states.
acceptanceCriteria: Product listing and product detail pages load data from the backend canister (not hardcoded).
Create-order action calls the backend and shows a success or error message.
All data-fetching views include a visible loading state and a visible error state.

file_operations.description: Create a small frontend wrapper around useActor to standardize access to the backend actor for React Query queryFns and mutations.
Add product data functions that call backend capabilities (getProducts, getProduct) and normalize UI-friendly shapes (e.g., bigint price formatting handled in UI layer).
Add order creation function calling backend capability (createOrder) and return the order ID for confirmation UI.
Implement a React Query hook for product listing with loading/error states consumed by Shop and Home featured sections.
Implement a React Query hook for product detail by ID with loading/error states consumed by Product Detail page.
Implement a React Query mutation for creating orders, exposing isPending/success/error for Checkout UX.

Create a consistent loading UI component used across data-fetching pages; compose (do not modify) existing shadcn-ui components where appropriate. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a consistent error UI component used across data-fetching pages (including authorization-trap friendly messaging); compose (do not modify) existing shadcn-ui components where appropriate. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire the Shop page to use React Query product listing hook; render LoadingState and ErrorState visibly.
Wire the Product Detail page to use React Query product detail hook; render LoadingState and ErrorState visibly.
Wire Place Order to React Query create-order mutation; show success/error UI and navigate to Order Confirmation on success.

Ensure actor lifecycle works cleanly with React Query (e.g., identity changes) and that authorization initialization errors are surfaced in a UI-friendly way for downstream ErrorState handling. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Apply a consistent fashion-forward theme (monochrome/cream palette, typography, spacing) across all pages with English UI text and “VUURIX” branding.
acceptanceCriteria: Theme is consistent across all pages (same design system for buttons, forms, product cards).
Color palette avoids blue/purple by default; use a refined fashion aesthetic (e.g., monochrome/cream with high-contrast accents).
All user-facing text is English and brand name appears as “VUURIX”.

file_operations.description: Create global styles (Tailwind base/components/utilities if applicable) and define a VUURIX fashion-forward palette (avoid blue/purple) plus base typography and layout defaults.
Create a shared layout wrapper enforcing consistent page spacing, max-width, and typographic rhythm across all pages.
Add a small formatting component for displaying bigint prices consistently (currency formatting + consistent typographic emphasis).
Wrap routed pages in the shared AppLayout and ensure all navigation labels and UI copy are English and use “VUURIX”.

Align product card styling to the theme (button styles, card spacing, text hierarchy) by composing existing shadcn-ui components (do not edit immutable ui components). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Apply consistent form styling (inputs, labels, validation messaging) using composed shadcn-ui components; keep all text in English. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add and render generated brand assets (logo, hero banner, product placeholders) from frontend/public/assets/generated for a polished MVP.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are committed under frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced by the UI.
Home page displays the hero banner and VUURIX logo.
Products without custom images display a consistent placeholder image.

file_operations.description: Add generated asset file at frontend/public/assets/generated/vuurix-logo.dim_512x512.png and ensure it is referenced by the UI (no backend image serving).
Add generated asset file at frontend/public/assets/generated/vuurix-hero.dim_1600x600.png and ensure it is referenced by the UI (no backend image serving).
Add generated asset file at frontend/public/assets/generated/vuurix-product-placeholder.dim_800x800.png and use it as the default when a product image is missing.
Add generated asset file at frontend/public/assets/generated/vuurix-product-placeholder-2.dim_800x800.png and make it available for optional UI variation if needed.
Add generated asset file at frontend/public/assets/generated/vuurix-product-placeholder-3.dim_800x800.png and make it available for optional UI variation if needed.
Create a BrandLogo component that renders frontend/public/assets/generated/vuurix-logo.dim_512x512.png in header and key brand touchpoints.
Render the hero banner frontend/public/assets/generated/vuurix-hero.dim_1600x600.png and include BrandLogo; ensure featured products use placeholder when missing images.
Create a ProductImage component that falls back to frontend/public/assets/generated/vuurix-product-placeholder.dim_800x800.png when the product image URL is empty/invalid.

Use ProductImage to ensure consistent placeholders for products without custom images; compose (do not modify) shadcn-ui components where appropriate. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Use ProductImage to ensure consistent placeholders on the Product Detail page when a product image URL is empty/invalid.
